alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN ASHLEY COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM CDT... At 109 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 10 miles southeast of Hilo, or 13 miles north of Huttig, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. These strong thunderstorms will be near... West Crossett around 115 PM CDT. Crossett around 120 PM CDT. North Crossett around 125 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Blanchton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
